page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content:
TRANSPORT THROUGH SILVERDALE
Silverdale is served by both rail and bus connections to towns and villages to north, south, east and west. The railway station, which is situated over one mile from the village centre, is on the Carnforth to Barrow line. About a dozen trains per day in each direction provide a convenient means of transport for commuters, mainly to Lancaster and Preston, but also across the Bay to Grange and beyond. The Ribble bus service which passes through the village centre provides a slower means of transport to Lancaster and Kendal, passing through many small settlements on the way.
